items.title: Add remaining page-types to LA

items.content_html:
FF115 supports rel="modulepreload" on the link element in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1425310.

This adds the release note.

FWIW a pretty cool feature because loading static module scripts is otherwise blocking until the full module graph is downloaded, while this allows the module to be loaded as soon as the tag is encountered, and since modules include their dependencies, those can then be downloaded in parallel too. It should be lots faster in most cases.

Other docs work tracked in #27177
items.title: FF115Relnote: link rel='modulepreload' supported

items.content_html:
Fix DataTransfer.types to remove incorrect statement "The order of the formats is the same order as the data included in the drag operation." When a DataTransfer includes 1 or more Files, a single type "File" will be last which may be out of order with items, and may mean that types.length < items.length.

As per https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dnd.html#concept-datatransfer-types

Description

Improve docs to make them more accurate.

Motivation

I am a chromium developer and I recently looked at a bug which related to DataTransfer. The existing docs confused me since they were incorrect when describing the relationship between order of DataTransfer.types and DataTransfer.items.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Improve DataTransfer.types description

• Made API links internal instead of pointing to spec

  • Namespaces are now implied in mathML, SVG, and HTML
  • change XHTML to HTML
  • removed some future-tensing as this doc was super old.

Only added a single link to CSS namespace API. after namespace documentation is complete will add a few more links, but that is a future PR
items.title: Update: namespace crash course

items.content_html:
Fixed issue where adding existing genre with lowercase letters created a new genre.

Description

Fixed issue where adding existing genre with lowercase letters created a new genre.

Motivation

Wanted to fix the error so multiple genres don't exist.

Additional details

This will provide insights to readers about how multiple collections can be created leading to bloat.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update index.md case-sensitive query

items.content_html:
After reading the old intro paragraph, I felt I had only a vague idea of what CORS is, and I was frustrated by what I saw as a lack of detail and beginner-friendliness in the explanation. I hope this edit is an improvement.

I replaced the old intro paragraph with four paragraphs:

The first paragraph summarizes what CORS is.

The second paragraph gives a high-level example of how it works. Although the intro already contains an example, I believe my example complements that one.

The third paragraph discusses the benefits and dangers of CORS.

The fourth paragraph describes how browsers can check servers for CORS compatibility using "CORS-preflight" requests.

Description

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Make the intro clearer, more precise, and more beginner-friendly

items.content_html:
Description

This PR revises the description about ETag validation of If-Match and If-None-Match HTTP headers.

Motivation

According to RFC 9110, strong comparison function must be used for If-Match, and weak comparison function must be used for If-None-Match.
https://httpwg.org/specs/rfc9110.html#conditional.requests

Current description seems to be different from this.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update description of conditional headers

items.content_html: Browser compat shows this has full support. All browsers tested support datetime-local, including min and max. So, removed lingo and fallback, and jquery plugin, etc.
